city: Marrowgate, called the Ribs of the Tide, is a river-delta metropolis built within the exposed skeleton of a sea-leviathan that rose from the flats six centuries ago. The city clings to ribs like terraces of bone and amberglass, with sailcloth roofs strung between vertebrae to catch monsoon winds. Its skull is a gate-citadel facing the Inner Shard Sea, and its tail vertebrae anchor docks that spider out into brine channels lit by ghostfire lanterns. Marrowgate survives on salt, bonecraft, glassmaking, river trade, and a deft balance of guild power. The Salt Parliament, a council of basin-families, convenes around evaporative pools to cast votes with colored brine, while the River Pilots guide all freight through the Nine Mouths of the delta. Bonewrights carve living bone into tools and constructs, and the Ember Collegium fires glass in desert kilns, turning dune-sand into saint-bright panes and lenses. The Tidemothers keep rites for the great water and teach that the leviathan is not dead but sleeping, its heartstone a red engine that must be soothed to keep the city from sinking. History here is written in cracked rib and patched sail. Founders were salt-panners and eel-spears who claimed the bones after the Stormfall Night, when a star broke and the sea retreated, exposing the leviathan. Three centuries ago, Scythe Sultans from the dunes laid siege until river storms broke their siege ladders with thunder pulled from the Skyhook chain. The Chordquake of 179 years past split the third rib and birthed the Ribsward Bazaar in the gap. Thirteen years ago, the heartstone flared and turned the water red; the Bonewright Covenant and Tidemothers bargained an uneasy accord to damp the pulse. Marrowgate depends on upstream grain terraces, resin and timber from mangrove and crag forests, sand from singing dunes, and the pilots who read shifting channels. Its conflicts are as tidal as its fortunes: smugglers of the Black Net bleed tariffs, the Collegium and Covenant contest the use of heart-power, and the Wardens keep a brittle peace with pikes and dull armor. Legends persist that the Ferryman Without Wake passes the channels on moonless nights, that thunder still sleeps in the broken Skyhook, and that when the leviathan truly stirs, every bone-stair in Marrowgate will sing.

surroundings.name: Salt Prism Flats
surroundings.description: Miles of mirror-bright salt pans east of the city, stepped by old guild lines and freckled with half-submerged obelisks from a civilization that worshipped light. Noon turns the flats into blinding sheets; dusk paints them in violet bands.
surroundings.legend: Travelers say a creature called the Mirror-Snipe walks the flats at noon, wearing the face of the last person to see you as a friend. It offers directions that are always slightly wrong, luring caravans to old sinkholes.
resources: Prismatic salt crystals used in color-voting at the Salt Parliament
Shards of light-etched glass from buried lenses
Brine shrimp vats prized by alchemists
hazards: Heat mirage and disorientation at midday
Camouflaged brine-sinks that crust over like glass
Salt storms raised by distant thunder squalls
dependencies: Salt Parliament oversees extraction quotas and taxes caravans bound for Marrowgate
Ember Collegium purchases prism salts for lens-grinding and kiln-coloring
Black Net Syndicate smuggles unweighed sacks across night-markers
hooks: A prism lens unearthed by a pan family projects a map when moonlight strikes it
Guild markers have begun to move overnight, as if the flats themselves are sliding

surroundings.name: The Nine Mouths
surroundings.description: A maze of shifting channels where the Motherflow River divides into nine silt-heavy streams before meeting the sea. Reed villages on stilts drift with moorings, and channel markers are bone poles carved with pilot knots.
surroundings.legend: The Ferryman Without Wake is said to pole a skiff that never ripples the water. He answers questions for the price of a name and is feared by smugglers and saints alike.
hazards: Sudden channel cuts that strand barges on silt bars
Mangrove snakes in breeding season
River spirits offended by iron dumping
dependencies: River Pilots Conclave maintains channel charts and escorts
Tidemothers bless the posts and set weirs on equinoxes
Wardens levy transit tariffs at bone-lashed checkpoints
hooks: A tenth mouth has opened after a storm, uncharted and full of singing stones
Pilots report a drowned barge sailing upstream at night without crew

surroundings.name: Gloomroot Mangroves
surroundings.description: A labyrinth of black-barked mangroves whose roots host bioluminescent fungus. Bone eels weave nests that hang like ivory chandeliers, and the air smells of resin, peat, and salt.
surroundings.legend: The Mother of Eels takes the form of a woman with lamp-bright eyes; she bargains favors for offerings of bone and promises to adopt lost children as eels if they drown among her roots.
resources: Resins for sealants and shipwright pitch
Glow fungus used by archivists and divers
Bone eel teeth for charms and tools
hazards: Tide-surge that floods the inner groves without warning
Quickmire under leaf litter
Packs of brackish boars that guard their wallows
dependencies: Ossuary Archive buys glow fungus for night reading in the ribs
Pilots harvest root poles to set new markers in the Nine Mouths
Bonewrights trade bone carvings to mangrove clans for resin rights
hooks: Children in a reed village begin speaking a language no adult knows after a red tide
A resin pool traps a perfect reflection that does not match the viewer

surroundings.name: Monastery of the Glass Saints
surroundings.description: Where the dunes rise westward, monks build idols from glass fused by sun-mirrors and prayer. Their cloister is a cathedral of translucent saints casting colored light onto the sand.
surroundings.legend: One saint, the Saint of Cuts, is said to walk at dusk. She can slice truth from lies with a glass palm and demands that pilgrims pay in honest tears.
resources: High purity desert sand for glassmaking
Sun mirrors polished with prism salt
Pilgrim offerings and manuscripts etched into molten panes
hazards: Glass dust storms that flay skin and dull metal
Sand-sink devils that spiral travelers into the deep
Heat thieves that drink shadow
dependencies: Ember Collegium contracts with the monastery for sand quotas and lens prototypes
Salt Parliament mediates disputes over dune boundaries
Tidemothers trade water in exchange for pilgrimage rights
hooks: A saint-statue has begun to weep blood and rust glass nails
A sun mirror focused on the horizon reveals a moving city of heat

surroundings.name: Skyhook Chain
surroundings.description: A broken arc of meteoric iron links rising from a basalt promontory north of the city, once part of a sky bridge used to shepherd storms. Lightning still finds the chain during monsoon, singing it like a harp.
surroundings.legend: During the siege, a red-cloaked stormcaller walked the chain and plucked thunder like strings, breaking the raiders. Her cloak, said to be woven of cloud, is hidden in a link somewhere above the surf.
resources: Stormglass nodules formed by earth-struck lightning
Bird nests of sky swifts prized for delicacies
hazards: Lightning strikes that leap chain to chain
Magnetic eddies that erase compass memory
Barnacle ogres under the lowest links
dependencies: Wardens depend on the chain as a watch perch for sea raiders
Collegium harvests stormglass for arcane lenses
Pilots read wind from the chain hum before setting sail
hooks: The chain hums out of season, and long-dead links begin to glow
A scroll found in a rusted link names seven chords that can calm the heartstone

surroundings.name: Cairn of the Hollow King
surroundings.description: A ringed barrow of stacked slate on a chalk rise inland. Bone flutes set in the walls make the cairn sing when the south wind blows.
surroundings.legend: The Hollow King was a tyrant who hollowed himself to be a vessel for a storm. He promised his people rain forever; they drowned in two days. His voice still rides the wind at dusk, asking for a crown.
resources: Old coins stamped with spiral eyes
hazards: Sinkholes under the barrow chambers
Spite-haunts that ride the wind and whisper bargains
Lightning attraction during pressure dips
dependencies: Ossuary Archive collects barrow music for bone-script notation
Salt Parliament funds dig permits to sell coins at market
Black Net loots graves under moonless nights
hooks: A crown-shaped chalk ring appears in Marrowgate overnight, matching cairn patterns
Wind-harp notes begin to spell names of living councilors

surroundings.name: Red Terraces of Khen
surroundings.description: Tiered fields of rust-red clay rising along the Motherflow, fed by wooden weirs and hand-dug channels. Grain, river squash, and dye plants grow under prayer flags.
surroundings.legend: Farmers speak of a clay giant beneath the terraces whose back they farm. Each drought it shifts and new fields rise; each flood it turns and old ones sink.
resources: Red dye used by guild banners
hazards: Weir-breaks that send walls of water downstream
Terrace leeches that drink through boots
Bandits paid by rival river lords
dependencies: River Pilots negotiate passage tolls with weir lords
Salt Parliament guarantees grain prices to keep city bread stable
Wardens send levy patrols to keep raiders off the road
hooks: Grain barges arrive mildewed, but fields upstream are green as ever
A terrace collapses to reveal a rib of something not quite animal, not quite stone

buildings.name: Crown Gate Citadel
buildings.type: fortified gate and seat of order
buildings.description: A bastion carved within the leviathan skull. Teeth become murder-holes, the jaw a drawbridge over brine canals. Banner racks hang from the zygomatic arch, and the eye socket overlooks the Pilots' Lantern.
buildings.history: Raised from makeshift palisades by river clans into a bone citadel after the Stormfall Night. Rebuilt with basalt and stormglass after the Scythe Sultan siege.
secrets: A hollow root under the palate leads to smugglers caves used by the Black Net
A tooth engraved with storm runes hums when the heartstone flares
A ledger in a hidden suture lists unpaid debts owed by every councilor

notablePeople.name: Marshal Isera Bent-Pike
notablePeople.notes: Pragmatic, scarred, keeps a private shrine to the Ferryman

notablePeople.name: Archivist Vell
notablePeople.notes: Writes in bone-dust ink; knows which tooth opens the vault

buildings.name: Ribsward Bazaar
buildings.location: Gap split by the third rib overlooking side canals
buildings.description: A labyrinth of stalls, awnings, and bone ladders hung from a cracked rib. Goods are slung on net-ropes and traded with arm-length clasps across open drops. Night markets glow with eel-jars.
buildings.history: Founded after the Chordquake tore a passage between inner bones. Smugglers, pilgrims, and guilders meet where the Wardens cannot see every coin.
secrets: An old rib tunnel sealed by wax leads straight to the Heartward Engine
Bazaar singers use coded melodies to signal tax collectors
A saint mask made of glass whispers prices from a future market

notablePeople.name: Keth of the Nets
notablePeople.notes: Smiles like a cut; knows every ladder with a loose rung

notablePeople.name: Grandmother Brine
notablePeople.notes: Weights coins in her palm; counts favors more carefully than silver

buildings.name: Ossuary Archive
buildings.location: Sixth and seventh vertebrae, inner spine
buildings.description: Shelf-ribs hold bone tablets, glass panes etched with sunlight, and scrolls bound in eel-skin. Monks copy songs into bone-script and record wind from the cairn as notation.
buildings.history: Begun by a tide-priest who carved laws into whale bone so they would float through floods. Expanded under the watch of Bonewrights to protect city memory.
secrets: A codex of wind-harp notes describes a ritual to lull the heartstone
A shelf is grown rather than built; it bends away from names written upon it
A hidden reading room lit by glow fungus contains drowned books that whisper

notablePeople.name: Scribe Nalea
notablePeople.notes: Never speaks above a whisper; fingers stained with chalk

notablePeople.name: Brother Holl
notablePeople.notes: Gentle with fish, stern with vows; trades prophecies for ink

buildings.name: Heartward Engine
buildings.location: Within the rib cage near the sternum
buildings.description: An array of bone pistons and red crystal veins that pulse in time with the leviathan. It draws brine and fresh water through sluices to keep foundations steady and tides tempered.
buildings.history: Awakened in fragments over centuries as bones settled. Fully tuned thirteen years ago during the red tide crisis by a pact between Bonewrights and Tidemothers.
secrets: A cracked conduit leads directly to a heart chamber that still speaks in dream
Engine beats accelerate when glass saints are moved toward the city
If three ribs are struck in the right order, the engine opens a water gate

notablePeople.name: Master Caur
notablePeople.notes: Talks to machines as if to stubborn children; owes the Black Net a favor

notablePeople.name: Mother Rhy
notablePeople.notes: Hears the pulse as hymns; refuses to let iron near the engine

buildings.name: Salt Parliament Basins
buildings.location: Terraced evaporative pools on the citys southern flank
buildings.description: Circular basins tiled in prismatic salt. Delegates pour colored brine to vote, the resulting hue determining outcome by long custom. Windbreaks made of old nets keep dust off the pools.
buildings.history: The first basin was a flood-control pool turned forum when a drought made it symbolic to gather around remaining water. More basins were added as families bought seats.
secrets: Drain grates connect to a hidden room used to mix false hues
A banner closet conceals a tunnel to a smugglers rung
A forgotten law etched under a basin grants pilots veto during storm season

notablePeople.name: Speaker Thren
notablePeople.notes: Brine-burn scars on both hands; hates to be photographed by lenses

notablePeople.name: Page Linn
notablePeople.notes: Memorizes hues better than names; rides a bone-scooter

buildings.name: Pilots Lantern
buildings.location: Right eye socket of the skull, above the sea gate
buildings.description: A tower of bone and stormglass with a lens of saint-glass that burns pale green when fog rolls. Pilot knots line the walls like prayer beads.
buildings.history: Built after three barges broke on the teeth; the Conclave vowed no ship would split on bone again.
secrets: A dark setting reveals ghost routes used by the Ferryman
A lantern keeper hides maps in the hollow of a knot-rope
Light rhythm can signal safe harbors to smugglers

notablePeople.name: Old Marr
notablePeople.notes: Blind in one eye, sees currents with the other

notablePeople.name: Sela Tidecount
notablePeople.notes: Predicts fog by the taste of wind; loathes the Ember Collegium

buildings.name: Seam-Menders Hall
buildings.location: Lower ribs near the reed quays
buildings.description: A crescent hall lined with bone braces, splints like ivory feathers, and vats where brine and herbal teas cure grafts. Fishers and guards alike queue for mended limbs.
buildings.history: Founded by a Bonewright who lost both hands and built new ones. Adopted by the Covenant as a public face after riots against bonecrafting.
secrets: A locked ward grows living bone lattice that responds to music
Medical records hide coded transfers to a smuggler fund
A physician replaces memories along with bones for select clients

notablePeople.name: Doctor Harl Quay
notablePeople.notes: Laughs often, never during surgery; rumored to be grown from a rib

notablePeople.name: Aunt Pike
notablePeople.notes: Knows every Warden by blood type and favorite drink

politics.name: Salt Parliament

leaders.name: Speaker Thren
leaders.title: Rotating Speaker
leaders.traits: Calculating, ritual-bound, superstitious about color omens

holdings: Salt Parliament Basins
Basin granaries along the lower ribs
Customs house at the reed quays
resources: Militia levies during flood or fire
goals: Keep bread and salt stable to prevent riots
Control appointments to the Wardens
Limit the Bonewrights reach into engine matters
rivals: River Pilots Conclave during storm season
allies: Ember Collegium, when glass prices favor the city
dependencies: Relies on Pilots to move taxed goods
Requires Collegium lenses for accurate hue voting
Depends on Tidemother rites to sanctify legal oaths
hooks: A faction proposes replacing colored brine with glass counters made by the Collegium
A missing basin key threatens to invalidate a session
politics.history: Evolved from river clan moot to a formal council after famine riots. Authority flows from custom as much as writ.

politics.name: River Pilots Conclave
politics.type: guild of navigators and barge masters
politics.motto: Where water goes, we go first
holdings: Pilots Lantern
Knot halls along the docks
A leased basin for guild feasts
resources: Fleet of pilot skiffs and signal flags
goals: Maintain control of river guidance and toll-sharing
Win veto power during storm season as per forgotten law
Break the Upper Weir Lords embargo on barge widths
rivals: Black Net Syndicate for illicit routes
Upper Weir Lords outside the city
allies: Temple of the Tidemothers during equinox rites
dependencies: Needs Ember Collegium lenses to read fog signals at range
Relies on Bonewright-braced docks
Depends on Parliament charters for legal protection
hooks: A new channel opens that only the Ferryman can traverse
A pilot is found with river silt in lungs despite drowning on dry land
politics.history: Born of necessity when channels split and merged yearly. The Conclave shifted from kinship circles to a merit ring after a deadly fog year.

politics.name: Bonewright Covenant
politics.type: artisan order of bone shapers and engineers

leaders.name: Doctor Harl Quay
leaders.title: Seam-Mender
leaders.traits: Gregarious, experimental, suspected of forbidden grafts

holdings: Seam-Menders Hall
Workshops in three lower ribs
A sealed vault beneath the Heartward Engine
goals: Keep stewardship of the Heartward Engine
Expand acceptance of living bonecraft in civic life
Discover the true nature of the heartstone without ceding control
rivals: Temple of the Tidemothers on ritual authority
allies: Select Black Net brokers for rare reagents
dependencies: Needs resin and fungus from Gloomroot
Requires river tax exemptions to import materials
Depends on Tidemother cooperation during pulse ceremonies
hooks: A living brace grows teeth in the night
Engine pulses mimic wind-harp songs from the Cairn of the Hollow King
politics.history: Formed by healers and builders who first stabilized houses on the bones. Distrusted after a series of graft scandals, they rebuilt reputation through public charity.

politics.name: Ember Collegium
holdings: Kiln row near the windward ribs
Contracts with the Monastery of the Glass Saints
A private stormglass lab under the Skyhook escarpment
goals: Monopolize prism salt usage in hue voting
Prove stormglass can dampen the heartstone without Bonewright rites
Open overland trade to dune cities through glass signal towers
rivals: River Pilots who resist glass signals
Temple of the Tidemothers for theological reasons
allies: Certain Wardens who want better armor
dependencies: Needs desert sand and monastery goodwill
Requires stable salt quotas
Depends on Pilots to ship fragile goods
hooks: A lens reveals an invisible script layering the citys laws
A kiln explodes, scattering shards that sing when gathered
politics.history: Took root when dune monks traded mirrors for salt. Gained power after inventing fog-cutting lenses; nearly lost it after a kiln-plague blackened lungs.

politics.name: Temple of the Tidemothers
politics.motto: Bend with the deep, do not break

leaders.name: Mother Rhy
leaders.title: Tide-Mother
leaders.traits: Solemn, careful, hears the pulse as hymn

holdings: Shrines at channel posts
Inner sanctum near the Heartward Engine
Pilgrim steps cut into the tail bones
resources: Rituals to soothe tides and sanctify oaths
A network of faithful from reed villages to dune monasteries
goals: Keep the leviathan sleeping and the city afloat
Resist technological dominance over sacred waters
Convert the Black Net to tithe and atone
rivals: Ember Collegium for encroaching on rites
Salt Parliament when laws ignore seasonal taboos
allies: Bonewright Covenant for the Heartward Engine accord
dependencies: Needs offerings to maintain rites
Relies on Parliament protection against iconoclasts
Depends on Pilots to ferry priests to far shrines
hooks: A prophecy declares the Ferryman must be seated at the next basin vote
Sacred fish are found with glass in their bellies that reflects a stranger
politics.history: An old river faith made new by the bones. Their rites bound flood and drought to a liturgical calendar; their power rises with the tide.

politics.name: Black Net Syndicate

leaders.name: The Seamstress
leaders.title: Mistress of Masks
leaders.traits: Faceless, rumored to be three people, speaks in market cant

holdings: Hidden rung ladders in the Ribsward Bazaar
Caves under the Crown Gate palate
Secret moorings in a reed labyrinth
resources: Stolen lenses and forged basin seals
goals: Control contraband through the Nine Mouths
Place a proxy within the Salt Parliament
Acquire a key to the Heartward Engine for leverage
allies: Certain Pilots who prefer quiet coin
dependencies: Needs fog and festival crowds for cover
Relies on bribed Warden sergeants
Depends on Monastery sand trains for false crates
hooks: A ledger goes missing, and names of half the city could fall out
The Seamstress offers to smuggle a prayer into the heart chamber
politics.history: Coalesced from dock gangs and night market thieves. Grew sophisticated by laundering coin through respectable stalls.

politics.name: Wardens of the Crown Gate

leaders.name: Sergeant Blue
leaders.title: Harbor-Chew
leaders.traits: Old, smells of eel smoke, knows every dock rope

holdings: Crown Gate Citadel
Watch nests on the Skyhook Chain
Armory carved into a molar vault
resources: Pikemen, skiff patrols, and crossbow squads
Street informants paid in bread and safety
goals: Keep trade moving and blood off the ribs
Break the Black Net without breaking the Bazaar
Wrest autonomy from Parliament meddling
rivals: Ember Collegium when detaining their couriers
allies: Bonewright Covenant for triage and braces
dependencies: Needs Parliament stipends for wages
Relies on Pilots for storm warnings
Depends on Tidemother rites to consecrate oaths and dead
hooks: A Warden patrol vanishes near the mangroves, leaving only pike points and eel slime
A molar vault tooth cracks, and an old siege horn sounds from within
politics.history: From river militia to professional force after the siege. Their teeth badges are cut from worn leviathan chips, each sworn upon with brine.
